Sigh, for this disease, it’s difficult to tell what’s right/wrong as there’s are so many unknowns.

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2017 01:08PM Kidmanliang wrote: Rebecca and pajim, Thanks so much to both of you! We are still monitoring her CBC counts. Platelets are 99-105 10e9/L,around the low end; RBCs are 4.04, low end; WBCs are 7000+, still within normal range but slightly higher than her normal counts. After they pricked her finger, she had to use ice to stop it from bleeding. She has been having temporary small fever(99 F) as well. Currently she's in the middle of 10 times WBRT, and the RO doesn't seem to worry her blood counts too much. BTW, does anyone have experience with WBRT? It's her 4th time today, and she said her double vision did not get improved at all, in fact, it got slightly worse. Does it mean WBRT is not working? Or we have to wait for a while to see the results? Hope you are doing well. Prayers and hugs.

Before her brain mets were found, the second doctor suggested to do a chemo before moving on to letrozole as she believed there might be some vicious cells that don't respond to hormone therapy. I haven't heard of doing chemo before exhausting other drugs, but it kind of makes sense. They cannot do anything now as she's doing whole brain radiation, but they might change her treatment plan after the WBRT. Has anyone had similar experience or heard of it?

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2017 02:17PM Kidmanliang wrote: hi Pajim, Thanks so much for your response. I also told her to take pictures to show to her doctor. She found the recurrence a month ago, no symptom, but TMs were high. Then it took them a month to finish all other testings: biopsy, petcan, uri. MO told her to stop Tamoxifen until the new treatment and said it wouldn't progress too fast. He was wrong. She got worse day by day. Double vision made her not able to walk or see. Last thursday she started Femara,same day found more those bruises on arms and legs, which got worse Friday night, a quarter sized hematoma was found on her buttock when she showered. Ibrance arrived Friday night so she took one, the hematoma became bruise next morning. Since it spread to bones and brain, I wonder if it caused platelets problems which caused the bruises and hematoma. She's seeing her MO tomorrow, hope he will have some insight. I don't like her MO because he missed diagnose her brain mets when she told him she had a bit double vision and he also underestimated how aggressive the cancer cells in youngmy cousin, but he's probably the best MO in her area, so we don't know where else we can go.
